result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob A Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may not have any alcohol in or on the premises of home.  Defendant may not go into any establishments that sell alcohol except for restaurants and grocery stores.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.   Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including an AODA assessment, anger management and domestic violence counseling.  No violent contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob A Rodriguez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Judgment for Unpaid Fines, Forfeitures & Other Financial Obligations to deft -  Return to sender - Not deliverable as addressed; unable to forward.
Civil judgment to be entered against defendant for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.
Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served
DOC-Notice of Case Status change - revoked - sentenced to co. jail.

Bond forfeiture notice -
     Order forfeiting bail and notice of application for judgment. $500 sig bond; missed hrg 5-29-15

Attorney Domingo S. Cruz in court.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Def is not sure why the deft is not here today.
Def requests a stay of the warrant.
State does not object.
BTC: No appearance, Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited. -stay 48hrs.
Status conference on May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 30, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the victim ALPL (person, property, residence or family).   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Jacob A Rodriguez in court with attorney Gretchen G. Rosenke.  Defendant Jacob A Rodriguez in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
